HApplication

Simple application template.

Depends on HSystem

HApplication instances are good namespaces to bind your client-side logic to.  Feel free to extend HApplication to suit your needs.  The primary default purpose is root-level component (HView) management and being the root controller for onIdle events.

Summary
HApplication
Simple application template.
Instance variables
constructor
buildParents
Used by addView to build a parents array of parent classes.
addView
Adds a view to the app, HView defines an indentical structure for subviews.
removeView
Call this if you need to remove a child view from its parent without destroying its element, making it in effect a view without parent.
destroyView
Call this if you need to remove a child view from its parent, destroying its child elements recursively and removing all DOM elements too.
die
Stops this application and destroys all the views currently in this application.
destroyAllViews
Deletes all the views added to this application but doesn’t stop the application itself.
startIdle
Gets called by HSystem, is a separate method to make onIdle() extensions more failure resistant.
onIdle
Extend this method, if you are going to perform regular actions in a app.

Instance variables

type’[HApplication]’
viewsA list of child components bound to it through HView
parentUsually HSystem
parentsAn array containing parents, usually just HSystem
appIdThe unique id of the app
isBusyA flag that is true when the app is doing onIdle events or stopped.

See Also

HSystem HView

Usage example

var myApp = new HApplication(100);
var mySlider = new HSlider(new HRect(100,100,300,118),myApp,1.0,0.0,200.0);
mySlider.draw();
myApp.die();

constructor

constructor: function(_refreshInterval)

Parameter (optional)

_refreshIntervalAn integer value (in ms) used for onIdle polling events.

buildParents

buildParents: function(_viewClass)

Used by addView to build a parents array of parent classes.

addView

addView: function(_viewClass)

Adds a view to the app, HView defines an indentical structure for subviews.

Called from inside the HView constructor and should be automatic for all components that accept the ‘parent’ parameter, usually the second argument, after the HRect.

Parameter

_viewClassUsually this inside HView-derivate components.

Returns

The parent view specific view id.

See also

HView.addView removeView destroyView die

removeView

removeView: function(_viewId)

Call this if you need to remove a child view from its parent without destroying its element, making it in effect a view without parent.  Useful, for example, for moving a view from one parent component to another.

Parameters

_viewIdThe parent-specific view id.  Actually an array index.

See also

addView HView.addView destroyView die

destroyView

destroyView: function(_viewId)

Call this if you need to remove a child view from its parent, destroying its child elements recursively and removing all DOM elements too.

Parameters

_viewIdThe parent-specific view id.  Actually an array index.

See also

addView HView.addView removeView die

die

die: function()

Stops this application and destroys all the views currently in this application.

See also

HSystem.killApp destroyView

destroyAllViews

destroyAllViews: function()

Deletes all the views added to this application but doesn’t stop the application itself.

See also

addView HView.addView removeView destroyView die

startIdle

_startIdle: function()

Gets called by HSystem, is a separate method to make onIdle() extensions more failure resistant.  Do not override or change!

onIdle

Extend this method, if you are going to perform regular actions in a app.  Polled with the ‘priority’ interval timer given to <start>.

Very useful for ‘slow, infinite loops’ that don’t take all the client browser machine CPU cycles.

See also

<start> <renice> HSystem.reniceApp

A Rect object represents a rectangle.
addView: function(_viewClass)
Adds a sub-view/component to the view.
killApp: function(_appId,
_forced)
Stops polling and deletes an app instance (and its components).
reniceApp: function(_appId,
_refreshInterval)
Changes the priority of the app.
